intro: Haloragodendron gibsonii, commonly known as the Gibson’s haloragodendron, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and may have a slight pubescence, contributing to its drought tolerance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
